column4: I don't have a physical hub, dmesg said it sees the 5 ports in a hub
all the ports are direct to the mother board
the 'hub' you are describing is actually your onboard usb controller / chipset.
could you repst your question? i joined after you asked it. or pm or to me . .
has someone else suggest lsusb ?
ok type lsusb in a terminal, and see if it show's you anything connected to the usb :)
that's LS in lowercase not 1s yes :)
no response to lsusb
just a blank output? rargh. what have you got connected at the moment??
i'm wondering if this is the OLD   -   UCHI - OCHI thing, but it's been so long since i looked at that . ..
I've tried a usb stick, usb hard drive and a webcam
was the USB working at any point? ie if you had windows on it ?
usb is fine on windows xp
I even switched over to win xp a bit ago to make sure usb was working there
ouch ok. do you know how to use pastebin Miiikeee ?
dmesg
it don't think your supposed to use OCHI and UCHI at the same time. i will be afk for half an hour or so. i will have more time to look at it then, unless someone else can you help you.
since you haven't asked your question in a while, feel free to pipe up, and ask again :)
you have them both installed, that's the seemable problem, tehy are both loading
